abstract: Tony Gleaton, photographer known for his images of black cowboys in the American West and Mexico, and who went on to document the African diaspora in Latin America, dies at age 67.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Gleaton traveled light, by bus, without assistants, complex equipment or luxury lodgings, to document the lives of black cowboys and create images of the African diaspora in Latin America.

headline.main: Tony Gleaton, 67, Dies, Leaving Legacy in Pictures of Africans in the Americas
headline.print_headline: Tony Gleaton, 67, Dies, Leaving Legacy in Pictures of Africans in the Americas

snippet: Mr. Gleaton traveled light, by bus, without assistants, complex equipment or luxury lodgings, to document the lives of black cowboys and create images of the African diaspora in Latin America.
